result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Floeter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green Lake County Clerk of Court

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentences are to be consecutive to each other.

miscConds.notes:
-DNA sample
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Court orders a sobrieter for 6 months when the defendant is not in custody and leaves it up to the agent after the 6 months.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended

10:19 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has a resolution on all the cases but does not include the felony case.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to Count 1 on 2015CT45, Count 1 on 215CM115, County 1 on 2015CM144 and counts 1 & 2 on 2016CM38.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1 on 2015CT45, striking the refusal, count 1 on 2015CM115, count 1 on 2015CM144 and counts 1&2 on 2016CM38.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 on 2015CT45 be dismissed and all other counts/cases be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Statement by Bob Dore.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2015CT45 (OWI-2nd)

-28 days county jail, No Huber and to commence immediately.  Out of county service.
-Fine and costs totalling $1568.00 - to be paid within 60 days or payment plan
-Blood Draw Fee $42.50
-DL revocation - 16 months
-IID - 16 months
-AODA & any follow-up
-DNA sample


2015CM115

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-DNA sample
-Absolute sobriety
-Domestic Violence Counseling.
-Court orders a sobrieter for 6 months when the defendant is not in custody and leaves it up to the agent after the 6 months.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

2015CM144 (Count 1), 2016CM38 (Count 1 & 2)

60 days county jail stayed and places the defendant on probation for 18 months

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-DNA sample
-Absolute sobriety
-Court orders a sobrieter for 6 months when the defendant is not in custody and leaves it up to the agent after the 6 months.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Probation is to be concurrent to each other.  Jail is consecutive to each other if probation becomes revoked.

15CF111

Atty Privat requests bond modification and speedy trial.  Court denies the request for bond modification.  Court sets for Status Hearing on March 8, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

All motions and witness lists to be filed by March 7, 2016.

Court adjourned at 10:45 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 09:00 am

1:41 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - investigator is doing some work and was out of the office and will return on Thursday.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on March 7, 2016 at 1:42 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:42 p.m.

10:30 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - still waiting on Discovery on the felony file and most recent misdemeanor case.  Court sets for Status Hearing on January 5, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:31 a.m.
Status hearing at 12-01-2015 10:00 am

10:05 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing on 2015CF111.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Atty Privat files discovery.  Court sets all cases for Status Hearing on December 1, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 10:08 a.m.
Status hearing at 11-02-2015 09:45 am

2:14 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat represents the defendant on the other pending cases.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5000.00 cash bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Diane E. and Michelle A.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set all cases for Status Hearing on November 2, 2015 at 9:45 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m.
Status hearing at 10-26-2015 10:00 am

11:24 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set all cases for Status Hearing on October 26, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.
  If violation of bond - next bond will be a cash bond.

Court adjourned at 11:28 a.m.
Status hearing at 09-22-2015 11:00 am

10:30 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the Court - will schedule this case for an initial appearance and the other cases for Status Hearing on September 22, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  Fail to appear a warrant will be issued.

Court adjourned at 10:31 a.m.
